description: A heavily classified document containing schematics for Northrups ATSV combat walker.
A broken chicken walker.  Still looks intimidating despite being permanently inoperative, possibly due to the sheer size and mass.  Could be gutted for parts.

This is an inactive chicken walker.  Using this item involves placing it on the ground, loading the unit with the factory-loaded 5.56 rounds and 40mm cartridge grenades in your inventory (if you wish to divide your ammunition, set aside whatever ammunition you do NOT want to give the robot) and turning it on.  If reprogrammed and rewired successfully the tank drone will then identify you as a friendly, roam around or follow you, and attack all enemies with a built-in firearm and grenade launcher.
//: cheating a bit with the volume due to lack of proper vehicle storage options

use_action.friendly_msg: The chicken bot rolls out and begins acquiring targets.
use_action.hostile_msg: The chicken bot swivels its turret and aims directly at you.  Don your brown pants!
use_action.//: Milspec, clearly designed with little concern for collateral damage.  What did you expect of a chicken walker?

description: What's left when you remove all moving parts and electronics.  It's the skeleton and armor of the pathfinder.

name: walker chassis
description: An ATSV chassis, hand-forged from scrap.  An integral component for bootleg walkers.

name: super chassis
description: An ATSV chassis, carefully crafted with the best materials and to the highest standards possible in a post-Cataclysm world.

name: packed chicken walker
description: An Northrup ATSV, packed for transport.  Armed with a 5.56 anti-personnel rifle, an anti-vehicle 40mm grenade launcher and a tazer.  Use this item to unpack and load with up to 1000 5.56 NATO M855A1 and 50 40mm frag rounds.

use_action.friendly_msg: The walker begins scanning for hostiles.
use_action.hostile_msg: You misprogram the walker; it's IFF identifies you as hostile!

name: packed unarmed super walker
